title: Seven Layer Cookie Bars Recipe
description: These 7-layer cookies with butterscotch, coconut, chocolate, and chopped nuts are easy to make and perfect for a deliciously gooey, sweet treat!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips EAGLE BRAND® Seven Layer Cookie Bars 4.7 (271) 189 Reviews 34 Photos These 7-layer cookies with chocolate, coconut, butterscotch chips, and chopped nuts are easy to make, easy to share, and sure to satisfy your sweet tooth! Submitted by Eagle brand Updated on October 18, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 34 34 34 34 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 24 Yield: 2 dozen Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe These seven layer cookie bars feature (you guessed it!) seven layers of sweet, rich, and easy-to-find ingredients. Seven Layer Cookie Bars Ingredients These are the ingredients you'll need to make this seven layer cookie bar recipe: · Graham cracker crumbs: A graham cracker crust is the perfect base layer for these seven layer cookie bars.· Butter or margarine: You can use whichever you have on hand!· Sweetened condensed milk: Because doesn't sweetened condensed milk make everything better?· Candy morsels: Chocolate chips and butterscotch chips are sprinkled over the sweetened condensed milk layer.· Flaked coconut: Opt for sweetened coconut flakes, if you can.· Chopped nuts: Peanuts, pecans, and walnuts are all great options. How to Make Seven Layer Cookie Bars You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make seven layer cookie bars at home: 1. Make the graham cracker layer and press it into a baking pan.2. Pour the sweetened condensed milk over the crust.3. Add the chocolate and butterscotch chips.4. Top with flaked coconut and chopped nuts.5. Bake until lightly browned. Cool, then cut into squares. How to Store Seven Layer Cookie Bars Place the seven layer cookie bars in an airtight container and store at room temperature for up to four days or in the refrigerator for up to one week. Can You Freeze Seven Layer Cookie Bars? Yes, you can freeze seven layer cookie bars for about three months. Flash freeze them for a few hours or up to overnight, then transfer them to a freezer-safe container. Thaw at room temperature. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "This is absolutely delicious and easy to make," raves Mary Harkleroad. "I have made this every week for the last 3 weeks. It's that good." "These are ALWAYS a hit," according to Jan L. "My husband absolutely loves these. Lucky for him, he is very skinny. These are like a super rich cookie-candy bar. I keep the ingredients on hand constantly. You can put these together in minutes." "It is delicious, however I like to use peanut butter chips instead of butterscotch ones," says Oaksfan. "Also, to make it come out of the pan easier, I line the pan with either foil or parchment paper." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 1 ½ cups graham cracker crumbs ½ cup butter or margarine, melted 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND® Sweetened Condensed Milk 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips 1 cup butterscotch-flavored chips 1 ⅓ cups flaked coconut 1 cup chopped nuts Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) or 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for a glass baking pan. Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter together in a small bowl until combined. Press crumb mixture firmly on the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking pan. Pour sweetened condensed milk evenly over crumb mixture; layer evenly with chocolate chips and butterscotch chips. Top with flaked coconut and sprinkle over chopped nuts; press down firmly with a fork. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 25 minutes. Cool. Chill if desired. Cut into bars or diamonds. Store covered at room temperature. I Made It Print 512 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Seven Layer Cookie Bars 01 of 34 Photo by  Chef V 02 of 34 Photo by  Claudine 07/07/2024 Great flavors 03 of 34 Photo by  Anne Pius 06/24/2022 The amount of ingedients is accurate. The directions are clear. The bars came out perfectly. 04 of 34 Photo by  Stacy 08/31/2021 05 of 34 Photo by  Louise Holmes 12/24/2020 06 of 34 Photo by  Vicki 05/29/2020 07 of 34 Photo by  Mendez1389 02/03/2020 08 of 34 Photo by  Wade Fletcher 12/24/2019 09 of 34 Photo by  Meredith Metschulat 12/21/2019 These taste amazing! My husband just about ate the whole batch! Guess I’ll be making them more often! :-) 10 of 34 Photo by  James Bryan 09/24/2019 Took me 10 mins to make it. I didn’t add walnut because I don’t like walnut. But just everything without walnut. Very tasty. Even my kids love it. name: Eagle brand
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) or 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for a glass baking pan.;Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter together in a small bowl until combined. Press crumb mixture firmly on the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking pan.;Pour sweetened condensed milk evenly over crumb mixture; layer evenly with chocolate chips and butterscotch chips. Top with flaked coconut and sprinkle over chopped nuts; press down firmly with a fork.;Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 25 minutes. Cool. Chill if desired. Cut into bars or diamonds. Store covered at room temperature.
